Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an ICS asset management policy and procedures that are aligned with the organization wide information asset management policy and procedure for the identification, management and protection of ICS assets in line with applicable laws and regulations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies, documents, and maintains an asset register of all critical ICS assets for the entire ICS environment, including the related ICS facilities and components, such as PLCs, RTUs, SCADA/DCS servers, engineering stations, operators stations, network devices, software assets, people assets, physical assets, etc. and consider other details such as, asset classification, physical location, license details, business value, and any other necessary information that may be required to avoid risks and recover from disasters.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization appoints designated employees with the responsibility to perform periodic review of the asset management register and enforce policies and procedures to periodically update the register for accuracy
Heading: No

Clause Description: In case of utilizing asset inventory tools, the organization ensures appropriate testing of the tool in non-production environments prior to deployment in the ICS production environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Keeps inventory of all physical access devices owned by the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes and implements ICS asset ownership policy, where ICS assets are identified with an owner. Business processes, services, applications, ICS systems, or set of data are examples of assets that ownership should be allocated to.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Assigns the ICS assets owner the responsibility of ensuring that classifications of ICS assets are carried out based on the sensitivity of operations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Assigns the ICS assets owner the responsibility of defining the access control (physical & logical) to the ICS assets and ensuring periodic review of access in accordance with assigned classification level and the organization’s access control policy.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Assigns the owner the responsibility of maintaining the day to day operational tasks related to the ICS assets, while considering the higher authority of the assets by the owners.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines and implements a classification scheme/ process for ICS assets to be used within the organization based on ICS assets criticality, value, legal and protection requirements, etc. in line with applicable laws and regulations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains ICS classification policy and related procedures in line with applicable laws and regulations, for e.g. data classification regulations provided by the Emirate of Dubai
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures classification of ICS assets based on criticality. The organization defines criticality of the ICS assets by deriving the Availability, Integrity and Confidentiality ratings of individual ICS systems and based on the impact to the safety functionalities of the system.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures periodic asset review for enabling an update of the Asset register.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines and implements adequate labeling and handling controls for the ICS assets (electronic and physical); according to the requirements of each classification level, considering the handling requirements, storage procedures, distribution limitations, etc., for each ICS asset.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains procedure for the ICS assets labeling and handling requirements.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies and implements the required safety and security measures prior to the disposal of ICS assets based on their value, criticality and sensitivity. This should be applied to ICS assets that either reached the End of life or are no longer needed for operations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains clear procedure for the process of disposal of ICS assets, which includes irretrievably erasing all information including any code or configurations before securely physically disposing such assets.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an acceptable use policy governing the use of ICS assets including restricting usage of personal devices in or nearICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops a risk assessment methodology that aligns with the requirements of the organization’s information security program, covering the life cycle of the ICS asset (from identification till disposal).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Determines a periodic plan for conducting the risk assessment across the organization's operational/production environments.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies the criteria of acceptable risks as part of the risk assessment methodology.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies the scope of the risk assessments involving key stakeholders, around their business processes & respective critical ICS assets that will be included in the assessment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Plans and implements a periodic awareness of the risk assessment program across the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conducts & maintains a detailed risk assessment addressing various types of risks (E.g. Security, Health & Safety, Environmental, etc.), for the identified critical information assets, in accordance with the approved risk assessment methodology.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Analyses risks and prioritizes them based on the criticality, to set treatment plans and controls.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Determines and identifies the acceptable risks in accordance with the risk assessment methodology.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Documents the risk assessment results in a risk register, which is approved officially by higher management. The risk register shall be updated on a continuous basis.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Selects the risk treatment plans (mitigate, avoid, transfer, etc.) for the identified risks, approved by the higher management.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Performs and implements the mitigation controls for the risks identified.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Reviews and monitors the implemented risk mitigation controls for effectiveness.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Documents the residual non-treated risks with justifications and gets it signed off by higher management.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented policy and procedure for the management and handling of ICS security incidents.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes a technology capability (Incident Response Team) to identify,analyse, eliminate, prevent and recover from the ICS security related incidents ranging from process IT, automation, ICS operations & maintenance across the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Performs regular (quarterly) exercises with the Incident Response Team to exercise & execute effective handling of ICS security incidents.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develop mechanisms to detect, analyze, contain, eradicate and recover from ICS Cybersecurity incidents.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Performs classification, as per a documented classification scheme, of various types of ICS Incidents so that the potential impact and suitable mitigation approach is mapped.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures the distribution, review and approval of the Incident response plan from relevant operation teams and Stakeholders.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Perform Post-mortem or Lessons learnt activities after incidents to improve the process and ensure that control updates are communicated to the control owners.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Assigns responsibility to designated employees or users dealing with the organization's ICS operation and information, through appropriate means, for reporting promptly any observed or suspected ICS security incidents or weaknesses in systems or services, to the responsible organization’s team.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements an escalation process for reporting ICS security incidents identified as high severity for the organization and identifies and engages external authorities for further investigation if needed for such incidents.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines timelines for reporting on identified responses and enables suitable measures for ensuring adherence to defined timeline.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Wherever feasible, the organization adopts automated reporting mechanisms thereby enabling ease and efficiency of Incident response.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement a process to gather and retain evidences related to any ICSsecurity incidents.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensure that personnel involved in incident management are trained in the correct handling of evidence.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops a knowledge base from all occurred ICS security incidents, with the focus of preventing and protecting the organization ICS assets from identified risks and related incidents, which includes details of incident types and any other relevant information.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops a repository of current ICS security incidents that are relevant to the organization’s operations and ICS environment. Performs root cause analysis of such incidents and adopts means to assure the organization of protection from such identified risks.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an access control policy that addresses all security requirements for the implementation of an effective access control for ICS assets within the ICS environment of the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an access control procedure that provides implementation details for access control, based on role-based access control(wherever possible) to individual ICS systems and components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures the ICS security access control policy clearly defines security roles, responsibilities and necessary cross-functional coordination among teams responsible for the operation, installation and maintenance of the ICS systems and components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures periodic review and update of the Access Control policy and procedures in accordance with dynamic risks identified in the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines and implements a process for ICS system user registration, de-registration, and users access privileges modification, disabling or removal, etc.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Provides each ICS system user with a unique identifier (user ID) for their individual business use only.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements a unified user ID standard across the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements an authentication technique for the validation of claimed identities of users regarding access being on-site and remote.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains appropriate authentication policy specific to the ICS environment (e.g. a password management policy that clearly addresses the password allocation process, ICS system users’ responsibilities on passwords use and the recommended password structure, etc.).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies the categories of ICS system users requiring regular and special privileges by ensuring the availability of the following:
Heading: No

Clause Description: A valid and approved access authorization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Other attributes as required by the organization or associated missions/ business functions.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Utilization of access accounts with special privileges must be restricted for their intended purpose and only within the intended ICS systems and components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Performs a periodic review of ICS users having privileged access rights on the ICS systems to ensure that the access privileges are commensurate with their job responsibilities.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Limits the number of special/high privileged user IDs to those individuals who absolutely must have such privileges for authorized business purposes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement security and independent monitoring controls over the usage of special or high privileged IDs within the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Employs a process for review and re-authorization of user access rights on a periodic basis, as defined by the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures usage of shared accounts within the ICS environment only for non-administrative functions such as, functioning of operator stations, operation monitoring and analysis etc. In such cases, the organization maintains a list of users with access to the shared account login and password credentials and performs periodic reviews of user activity logs.
Heading: No

Clause Description: For critical operations deemed by the organization, the organization shall deploy appropriate approvals prior to execution of operation ensuring reliability and accuracy.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization enables exceptions for control 5.2.1.12; for operations mandating instantaneous response for securing plant safety, based on higher management approvals.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Wherever deemed appropriate, the organization ensures protection of Information confidentiality within the ICS environment, limiting access only to authorized users for both data at rest and in transit, using suitable methods such as encryption, compartmentalization, physical separation etc.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization explicitly defines ICS operational zone boundaries and deploys suitable protection measures for ensuring security of data traversing across zone boundaries.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a policy for network access control, which covers details about accessible networks and network services, authorization process for granting network access, etc.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines a process for authorizing, activating and terminating any network connections in the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement network access control tool/method for network equipment/devices connectivity detection, identification and authentication.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Remote access to the ICS systems should be restricted and granted only under circumstances where it is absolutely needed. Remote access should be granted only after approvals are obtained.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements authentication tool for remote access connections.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Manage and controls access to configuration ports on network equipment/ devices.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement segregation controls on between ICS and other networks(internal, external, wireless, IP telephony, etc.).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures deployment of Network Segmentation with restricted logical security access enabling network design simplification and isolation of network traffic within designated zones of operation.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensure the Network switches used in the ICS environment are configured with appropriate rules and the defined rule set is periodically reviewed for integrity and uniformity across the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures a risk-based review of enforced security policies and traffic segregation rules on managed switches in line with necessary mitigation steps to identified risks.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables multi-factor authentication within the ICS environment wherever applicable. In particular, connections established from External/Untrusted networks must be routed via a multi-factor authentication mechanism prior to being given access to the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes network monitoring and analysis mechanisms for monitoring traffic from such untrusted network.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables remote session termination controls (Manual or automatic) such that internal users exercise the control to instantly terminate remote connections or set configurable time-slots for external users to operate within.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Manages and controls the use of utility programs within the ICSenvironment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements session time-out controls to prevent unauthorized access.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements lock-out policy.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Restricts connection times and persistent connections for critical ICSsystems and applications.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Records and continuously reviews logs of administrator system IDs.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization shall also enforce users to periodically change their passwords and to ascertain the use of the same password only after a certain number of times.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization enables a mechanism to lock user accounts post a consecutive number of unsuccessful login attempts. The users should be re-enabled access only upon having prior procedures in check.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an ICS remote access security policy addressing remote access to the organization’s resources (remote access should be allowed only for exceptional cases based on business requirement).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces authorization prior to remote access connections to the ICSsystems/components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures that adequate security controls are implemented on the end point machines, such as authentication, encryption, antivirus software, personal firewalls, session timeout, content filtering etc.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Provides remote access users with access to the services, which the users are specifically authorized to use.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Monitors and periodically reviews the remote access connections logs.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables multi-factor authentication for users connecting to the ICSenvironment from remote locations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Wherever feasible, deploys bi-directional authentication for remote connections to enable stronger security control.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures remote connections are enabled only to systems that require to be accessed remotely by users.
Heading: No

Clause Description: BYOD (bring your own device/personal devices) should not be allowed within ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented policy on the wireless network usage within ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Authorizes the wireless access to the ICS network prior to any connection.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement authentication control for the wireless access.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforce security control for wireless connections to the  network and establishes usage restrictions and implementation guidance for such use.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Provides wireless connection users with access to services that they have been specifically authorized to use.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Monitors continuously for any unauthorized wireless access to the network.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Deploys mechanisms to ensure unique identification and authentication of all users over wireless communication networks.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces wireless use restrictions, monitoring mechanisms and authentication controls for wireless utility to the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables mechanisms to identify unauthorized users within the ICSenvironment and adopts suitable reporting mechanisms to prompt timely action.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented physical access policy that addresses the organization’s requirements for implementing physical access controls on control rooms, maintenance rooms, engineering environments etc.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Supplements, as necessary, the physical access policy with a detailed procedure on how to implement the protection controls and provides users with complete specification on physical security safeguards to be deployed within the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces authorization prior to physical access to any facilities with ICSsystems.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces appropriate physical access control perimeters for all physical access points to the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Verifies and ensures that only authorized employees are provided access to protected areas.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Controls entry to ICS facility using physical access control devices.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Controls and monitors physical access to the ICS and nearby environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Safeguards and enforces adequate protection controls on systems that manage physical access.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Organization reviews logs of physical access on a regular basis.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Deploys mechanism to monitor the movement of employees & nonemployees within the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The organization deploys appropriate power backup solutions to ensure continued operation of the ICS environment within the defined secure state of operation.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces authorization prior to logical or physical access required by external party through deploying a «need to know» criteria.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Monitors and logs logical or physical access provided to public or external party.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Controls physical access to any areas that include ICS systems and other areas such as delivery, loading, or any other points where unauthorized personnel may enter by authenticating visitors before authorizing access.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Authorizes, monitors and controls entering and exiting the ICS facilities or any other public areas and maintains such records.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Sets physical access protection and control mechanisms on all external parties or outsourced individuals and hold them liable for any violation or compromising the organization’s ICS security policy.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements audit trails in ICS systems as per requirement.
Heading: No

Clause Description: maintains and periodically reviews logical and physical access control lists enabled within the ICS environment
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures advanced planning for availability of adequate capacity and resources for the Industrial controls systems (including support systems such cybersecurity technologies) and their technology components, in line with applicable regulations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conducts an annual projection review of capacity requirements and resources for the Industrial operation systems and their technology components, integrating business requirements, or immediately upon a significant change to existing system.
Heading: No

Clause Description: The automation systems security design and controls should aide in prevention of exhaustion of system resources, especially by less critical and low priority applications or software.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables mechanisms for continuously monitoring the software utility of key system resources such that the organization can ensure adherence to control no. 6.1.1.3 in a manner preventing shortage of resources.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops and maintains a complete set of operating procedures documentations of all Industrial operation systems detailing inputs, outputs and dependencies.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Documents and maintains up to date baseline configurations manuals of all ICS operating and engineering systems including an inventory of constituent system components. The baselines should also include cybersecurity configurations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Only authorized personnel should have access to the baseline configurations. Any changes to the baselines should be logged and reviewed.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables adequate approval mechanisms involving necessary stakeholders prior to deploying changes to the ICS Operational procedures.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented change management policy that defines the overall change management process employed by the organization for ICS environment, outlining roles and responsibilities.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Supplements, as necessary, the change management policy with a detailed procedure to facilitate the implementation of the change and configuration management process and provide guidelines for all users.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements a change management process that must include the following details, as a minimum:
Heading: No

Clause Description: Description of required change.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Testing and implementation plans for the change.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Risk assessment of the change impact.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Official authorization of the change and the communication process for all stakeholders
Heading: No

Clause Description: Rollback process for recovery of unsuccessful changes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Approved maintenance windows during which the change will be implemented
Heading: No

Clause Description: Incorporates health and safety reviews for all significant changes. Thereby ensuring, continued security and safety of ICS systems.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Whenever applicable, the organization ensures performance of a change impact analysis to derive potential impact to the ICS prior to deployment of changes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures separation of change responsibilities to employees ensuring no overlap of duties.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Integrates ICS cybersecurity change management procedures with overall ICS change management procedures to enable integration of Cybersecurity within regular operation of the ICS systems and components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Maintains historical record of all changes being carried out within the ICS, recording necessary information to identify the change, date of change, purpose of change, responsible owner and other necessary information deemed appropriate by the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops and distributes a configuration Management policy enabling the organization to establish baseline configuration requirements, manage configuration changes and define cross-functional responsibilities necessary for the management of ICS Systems/Components configuration.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements procedures for management, monitoring and documentation of configuration changes made to the ICS systems such as PLCs, DCS,HMIs, SCADA clients and servers, Operator stations and any other supporting ICS equipment and applications.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables access restrictions to ICS system configuration settings and performs periodic reviews to ascertain provision of access to necessary users.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Assessment should be performed to determine the change in cybersecurity risk level due to configuration changes applied on ICS systems.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures changes made to the ICS environment satisfy the cybersecurity requirements to address the risk level and overall provide the same or better degree of protection as the original equipment or configuration.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes and ensures uniform application of minimum-security baseline configuration of ICS systems and components.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes network and security configuration settings for the ICS systems in line with recommendations from corresponding System vendors. organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures periodic review and update of ICS security baselines for different ICS components upon identification of new risks, installation of new technology/components or changes to the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Segregates duties and responsibilities as necessary through distributing the tasks for a specific industrial operation / area among multiple users, in a manner to reduce errors, fraud and unauthorized modification or misuse of the organization’s ICS assets.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces restriction of access control to the ICS by implementation of segregation of duties as a part of employee’s job role. Thereby curtailing ICS access on a need-to-know basis and enabling validation by different users prior to deployment of high-risk operations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Segregates where necessary development, testing, production and processing facilities to mitigate the risk impacting the production systems from unauthorized intentional or unintentional access or change.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Allocates secured computing environment for ICS sections performing critical operations.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures that the development tools and compilers are not accessible from ICS operator systems.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures sensitive ICS operational information is not forwarded into the test environment. Thereby restricting access of sensitive plant information only within the organization’s ICS.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develop, distribute and maintain a documented policy and procedure for the acquisition, deployment and upgrade of ICS operation systems, addressing the organization’s requirements for ensuring security controls implementation and in line with organization’s baseline configuration requirements, prior to acceptance or deployment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines and implements acceptance criteria for new ICS systems implementation and upgrades and enforcing documented certification and accreditation process outlining security requirements.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Carries out suitable security testing of the ICS systems during development, prior to acceptance, deployment and ensures periodic testing.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, and maintains a documented agreement with the external party service providers that addresses compliance with the organization’s Insecurity requirements in addition to the organization’s ICS security controls.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Places adequate measures to assure that security controls, services definitions and delivery levels agreed upon in the external party contractual agreements are implemented and followed by the external party.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Monitors, reviews and audits the services and all related deliverables provided by external party in a regular basis.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Places adequate measures to manage and assess risks related to changes of the external party services. Examples of changes may include:
Heading: No

Clause Description: Application of new or enhanced security controls.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Updating organization’s policies/procedures.
Heading: No

Clause Description: New technology or new vendor to be used.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Identifies and nominates employees or internal service management teams to ascertain ownership for the management of external party services.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Incorporates necessary controls for monitoring and reporting of identified security incidents by the third party in agreement contracts to facilitate timely resolution and mitigation of Cybersecurity risks to the ICS.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces mechanisms to periodically review adherence to contractual statements mentioned in agreements with third parties.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented policy covering the requirements for prevention, detection and recovery controls against malicious codes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements documented procedures to deal with malicious code reporting and recovery.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conduct regular awareness across the organization on the importance of protecting the organization infrastructure from malicious code attacks.

Clause Description: Implements organization wide system/software for the malicious code scanning, detection and repairing.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Anti-malware solutions should be updated on a regular basis with latest signature files.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Performs periodic scans of all ICS systems and real-time scans of files from external sources as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed, as defined by the implemented policies.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes and maintains appropriate informative communication channels to obtain latest details of new malicious code.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops and implements continuity plans/procedures for recovery from malicious code attacks.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines the acceptable and unacceptable mobile code technologies.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Establishes usage restrictions and implementation guides for the acceptable mobile code technologies.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces authorization, monitoring and control over the use of mobile code technologies.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces restrictions on usage of mobile code (like flash & VB scripts, Java, Active x components, Flash, etc.) within the Control System network. Thereby effectively preventing execution of mobile code, restricting transfer of mobile code to ICS and vice versa and monitoring use of mobile code within the operation environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables mechanisms to validate the mobile code integrity prior to execution in the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables malicious code protection mechanisms at all entry and exit points of the ICS environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Wherever feasible, the organization ensures central management controls for protection against malicious code.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures updated malicious code definition files are not directly pushed from the Internet to the ICS systems. Enables manual update mechanism for smaller non-critical ICS systems and centralized mechanisms for updating larger critical ICS systems.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements documented process for its ICS network services to govern the interconnections between its network, critical owned business ICS systems and other networks and information systems outside its formal boundaries, outlining the roles and responsibilities of securing the connections and all other requisite issues such as duration of connection, ports, users’ access, etc.

Clause Description: Develops and implements network service agreements and ensures that all required security controls, service levels, and management requirements are included in such agreements.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables clock synchronization on all networking devices with agreed reference such as Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) to facilitate forensic analysis, and continuously monitor its accuracy.

Clause Description: Monitors the information system connections continuously and always verifies enforcement of security requirements.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements secure network routing controls.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements adequate protection level for the confidentiality, integrity and availability of transmitted information and, prevent unauthorized access to information or data in transit (whether within organization or to external network).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Terminates network connections associated with communication sessions as per the organization defined period of inactivity.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implement measures to ensure adequate/high level of network availability.
Heading: No

Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops and maintains full documentation of the network devices, connections, and IP configuration while ensuring highest security protection and controls on the documents.

Clause Description: Applies appropriate logging and monitoring procedures to enable recording of network security activities.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables network services to ICS environment without establishing connections to the organization’s IT environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures monitoring and control of communications within ICS zone boundaries to analyze network traffic and ascertain control upon identification of malicious traffic.
Heading: No

Heading: No

Clause Description: Enables necessary DoS prevention controls to manage ICS communication loads and limit DoS effects within ICS network compartments.

Clause Description: Provisions capability to restrict/prohibit use of unnecessary services, ports and protocols.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Enforces restrictions on person-to-person communication channels connecting ICS and IT environments.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements mechanisms to secure exchanged information from interception, misrouting, modification etc.

Clause Description: Enables mechanisms for detection and protection from malicious code that might be transmitted over electronic media.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Plans and conducts internal periodic audits to verify and report effectiveness of the implementation of the ICS Security controls.
Heading: No

Clause Title: Audit of Information Security Regulation Implementation
Heading: Yes

Clause Title: Audit of Information Security Regulation Implementation
Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a policy for conducting periodic ICSsecurity audits (risk-based audit) covering governance, operations and assurance aspects of the organization’s operations.
Heading: No

Clause Title: Audit of Information Security Regulation Implementation
Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented procedure, explaining the process for execution, to facilitate the implementation of the ICS security audit policy.
Heading: No

Clause Title: Audit of Information Security Regulation Implementation
Clause Description: Plans and conducts internal periodic audits to verify and report effectiveness of the implementation of the ICS Security & applicable standards, in line with the defined policy and procedure.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, selects and implements a set of ICS Security Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that are:
Heading: No

Clause Description: In support of the government organization strategic and operational planning processes to secure the organization’s mission.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Integrated into the annual reporting of effectiveness of the government organization's ICS security controls.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defined to assist in monitoring compliance with the ICS Cybersecurity Regulation.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Reviewed regularly and used to support policy, resources allocation, budget decisions, and as an assessment of ICS security program posture and operational risks.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Used to address issues and deficiencies and take corrective actions such as revising policies and procedures or provide information security trainings for employees.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Built from inputs of a variety of organization’s stakeholders, such as ICSoperations, incident response team, human resources, physical security team, or others using different data sources, such as risk assessments, penetration testing, and continuous monitoring.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Yielding quantifiable information for comparison purposes, while using formulas for analysis, and tracking changes using the same point of reference. Percentage, average or absolute numbers can be used, depending on the activity being measured.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Measured over consistent and repeatable ICS security processes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Integrates ICS security measurements and Key Performance Indicators(KPIs) in organization’s business processes and assigns business process owners the responsibility of achieving such measures.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Approves the organization’s ICS Security measurements and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) by the higher management of the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conducts periodic reviews on the results of ICS security measurements to ensure continual improvement of the ICS Cybersecurity program within the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Records actions and events that could have an impact on the effectiveness or performance of the ICS Cybersecurity standard.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Implements, as necessary, an integrated dashboard (or incorporates into an existing organization Performance Measurement tool) for combining all measured ICS Cybersecurity KPIs to be reviewed and monitored in a periodic manner, by the senior management and the responsible stakeholders, to ease the decision-making process, and facilitate the overall planning for  Cybersecurity program.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a documented cloud security policy that addresses the organization’s requirements for overall cloud management process and outlines roles and responsibilities of relevant stakeholders.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops, distributes and maintains a cloud security procedure that provides implementation details for establishing and managing secured cloud service environment.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conducts periodic reviews of cloud security policy and procedure or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Prevents handling and storing classified data with a Cloud Service Provider (CSP), outside the legal jurisdiction or geographical boundaries of the United Arab Emirates, including for CSP’s Backup or Disaster Recovery purposes.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Defines and communicates required security controls to Cloud Service Provider (CSP) for handling of data in accordance to the applicable laws& regulations (in line with ISR Ref. 11.1 and 11.2).
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures adequate cloud security controls are implemented by Cloud Service Provider (CSP) as per architecture and deployment model approved by the organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures through a documented agreement that the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) has no ownership rights on the stored data regardless of the format or storage medium.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Develops and maintains a documented agreement with Cloud Service Provider (CSP) addressing the following ICS security requirements as a minimum:
Heading: No

Clause Description: ICS security risks and mitigation
Heading: No

Clause Description: Data protection and storage
Heading: No

Clause Description: ICS security incidents handling
Heading: No

Clause Description: Change, Recovery and Restoration.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures that Cloud Service Provider (CSP) has the adequate measures and processes to support data portability whenever the organization decides to move its data.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Ensures cloud security controls are implemented by Cloud Service Provider (CSP), addressing organization’s requirements for periodic testing of the continuity and disaster recovery plans and communicating the results to organization.
Heading: No

Clause Description: Conducts periodic reviews or audits to verify Cloud Service Provider’s(CSPs) compliance with the applicable security policies and contractual requirements.
Heading: No
